about.name: Vienna
about.info_text: Vienna, the capital of Austria, is a city steeped in history, culture, and classical music. Known for its grand architecture, museums, and charming coffeehouses, Vienna offers a unique blend of old-world charm and modernity. Visitors can explore historic palaces, enjoy classical concerts, and savor traditional Viennese pastries. Vienna is also a center for international organizations, making it a city of global importance and influence.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.9 million
Country: Austria
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+1)
Language: German
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Vienna, the capital of Austria, has a temperate continental climate. Summers in Vienna are warm, with temperatures typically ranging from 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F), while winters can be cold, with temperatures between -2°C and 2°C (28°F to 36°F). Vienna experiences moderate rainfall throughout the year, with occasional snowfall during the winter months.

attractions_card.title: Schönbrunn Palace
attractions_card.description: Visit the magnificent Schönbrunn Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage site and former imperial summer residence.

attractions_card.title: Belvedere Palace
attractions_card.description: Explore the Belvedere Palace complex, housing an impressive collection of Austrian art and stunning gardens.

attractions_card.title: St. Stephen's Cathedral
attractions_card.description: Admire the Gothic architecture of St. Stephen's Cathedral, a symbol of Vienna, and climb its tower for panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Vienna State Opera
attractions_card.description: Attend a performance at the world-famous Vienna State Opera, known for its exceptional productions.

food_card.title: Sachertorte
food_card.description: Indulge in Sachertorte, a decadent chocolate cake with a layer of apricot jam and chocolate glaze.

food_card.title: Wiener Schnitzel
food_card.description: Try Wiener Schnitzel, a traditional Austrian dish featuring breaded and fried veal or pork cutlets.

food_card.title: Apfelstrudel
food_card.description: Enjoy Apfelstrudel, a famous Austrian pastry filled with spiced apples and raisins, often served with cream or vanilla sauce.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Sacher Vienna
hotels_card.description: Experience luxury at Hotel Sacher Vienna, a historic hotel known for its Sachertorte and elegant accommodations.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Vienna
hotels_card.description: Stay at The Ritz-Carlton, Vienna, a 5-star hotel located in a former palace with a rooftop bar and spa.

hotels_card.title: Motel One Wien-Staatsoper
hotels_card.description: Enjoy a comfortable stay at Motel One Wien-Staatsoper, a modern and affordable hotel near the State Opera.

transport_card.title: Vienna International Airport
transport_card.description: Arrive in Vienna via Vienna International Airport, the city's primary international gateway.

transport_card.title: Vienna Public Transport
transport_card.description: Use Vienna's efficient public transport system, including trams, buses, and the Vienna U-Bahn (subway).
